Text: October 26, 2016 LDS Church’s new ‘Mormon and Gay’ website wins cheers and some jeers for ignoring controversial policy Much has changed for gays and lesbians since 2012 in the U.S. and many parts of the world — same-sex marriage is legal, for starters — so the LDS Church decided it was time to redo, revise and reboot its website addressing that population. Among the biggest changes? The letter “s.” The previous site was known as “Mormons and Gays” — as if those two groups were separate or even opponents. The one that launched Tuesday is “Mormon and Gay,” signaling the notion that members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints can be — and are — both.
